channel.title: Knowledge and skills from leading universities on Koulutus ja Osaaminen
channel.description: Recent content in Knowledge and skills from leading universities on Koulutus ja Osaaminen

item.title: An MBA-equivalent education for free
item.description: Back when massive open online courses were new, I started a project to complete the equivalent of an MBA, using free courses. Platforms were making headlines, and when I learned that leading universities were distributing online courses for free, I was inspired to construct an education rather than pay an exorbitant amount for a degree.

item.title: How Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) Work
item.description: When two Stanford professors decided to offer their artificial intelligence (AI) course online, for free, to anyone interested in taking it, they’d expected a few thousand students, tops. But by the start of the class, they had 160,000 enrolled.

item.title: MOOCs and the Future of Learning
item.description: The trend toward MOOC legitimacy in higher education raises questions about where that education is headed. We live in an era of affordable, high-quality education for everyone, opening doors to college and career advancement.

item.title: The MOOC Revolution
item.description: Paul Kim brings together experts from higher education, business, law, learning analytics and other relevant areas to provide an evenhanded, research-based positioning of MOOCs within the existing educational technology landscape and a base for understanding whether they could reshape the future of education.

item.title: Coding for Everyone: C and C++
item.description: This Specialization is intended for all programming enthusiasts, as well as beginners, computer and other scientists, and artificial intelligence enthusiasts seeking to develop their programming skills in the foundational languages of C and C++. Through the four courses, you will cover the basics of programming in C and move on to the more advanced C++ semantics and syntax, which will prepare you to apply these skills to a number of higher-level problems using AI algorithms and Monte Carlo evaluation in complex games.

item.title: Developing Industrial Internet of Things
item.description: In this specialization, you will engage the vast array of technologies that can be used to build an industrial internet of things deployment. You’ll encounter market sizes and opportunities, operating systems, networking concepts, many security topics, how to plan, staff and execute a project plan, sensors, file systems and how storage devices work, machine learning and big data analytics, an introduction to SystemC, techniques for debugging deeply embedded systems, promoting technical ideas within a company and learning from failures.

item.title: Introduction to Cyber Security
item.description: This set of courses are designed to help learners develop a deeper understanding of modern information and system protection technology and methods. Learners will develop a lifelong passion and appreciation for cyber security, which will help in future endeavors. Students, developers, managers, engineers, and even private citizens will benefit from this learning experience. Special customized interviews with industry partners were included to help connect the cyber security concepts to live business experiences.

item.title: System Issues in Cloud Computing
item.description: This specialization is aimed at computer professionals to give them an in-depth experience in developing different layers of a Cloud computing infrastructure including software defined networks, distributed runtime systems, application development, and network function virtualization. Each course is organized as discussion of the technical details pertaining to that topic. Each one-hour video is followed by a hands-on workshop assignment.

item.title: Build a Modern Computer from First Principles
item.description: we will build some elementary logic gates, and then use them to build an ALU and a RAM. We then playe with low-level programming, assuming that the overall computer is actually available. Finally we will assemble all these building blocks into a general-purpose 16-bit computer.

item.title: CS50's Introduction to Computer Science
item.description: This is an introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming with or without prior programming experience.

item.title: CS50's Understanding Technology
item.description: This is an introduction to technology for students who don’t (yet!) consider themselves computer persons.

item.title: Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
item.description: This course aims to teach everyone the basics of programming computers using Python. We cover the basics of how one constructs a program from a series of simple instructions in Python. The course has no pre-requisites and avoids all but the simplest mathematics. Anyone with moderate computer experience should be able to master the materials in this course.

item.title: Brand Management: Aligning Business, Brand and Behaviour
item.description: Professor Nader Tavassoli of London Business School contrasts traditional approaches to branding - where brands are a visual identity and a promise to customers - to brands as a customer experience delivered by the entire organisation.

item.title: BSc Computer Science degree
item.description: The BSc Computer Science degrees are designed to give a strong foundation in Computer Science and specialised knowledge of topics such as Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Gaming and Web Development. The programmes are structured into three levels, so you’ll need to attend them in order to gain the equivaent of BSc in Computer Science.

item.title: Learning How to Learn
item.description: This course gives you easy access to the invaluable learning techniques used by experts in art, literature, math, science, and many other disciplines. We’ll learn about the how the brain uses two very different learning modes and how it encapsulates information.
